prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Curved Top and a Flat Bottom Step 1: Create the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system based on the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.3, 0.0] Step 2: Draw the 2D Sketch Draw the 2D sketch in the X-Y plane of the created coordinate system. Sketch the profile of the part using the following curves: - line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.45] - line_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.45], End Point [0.6, 0.45] - arc_1: Start Point [0.6, 0.45], Mid Point [0.375, 0.225], End Point [0.15, 0.45] - line_4: Start Point [0.15, 0.45], End Point [0.0, 0.45] - line_5: Start Point [0.0, 0.45], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Step 3: Apply Scaling and Transformation Scale the 2D sketch by 0.75 and apply the Euler rotation and translation vector from the coordinate system, creating a 3D sketch. Step 4: Extrude the Sketch Extrude the 3D sketch along the Z-axis (or the normal direction) by 0.3 units, while keeping the original sketch width and height as described in the JSON file (Width: 0.3, Height: 0.75). This will create the desired 3D shape, adding the new body as a part of the assembly. Final Shape Details The final shape will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a curved top and a flat bottom. The top and bottom edges will be rounded, and the sides will be straight. Dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.3 - Height: 0.75</description>

prompt: <description>**Instructions for Constructing the Final Shape** The final shape is a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top. It can be constructed by creating and combining three intermediate CAD parts. **Part 1** Construct the first part of the shape by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Create a sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. The sketch should contain one face with a loop consisting of four lines. The lines have the following start and end points: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.5] - Line 3: [0.75, 0.5] to [0.0, 0.5] - Line 4: [0.0, 0.5] to [0.0, 0.0] Extrude the sketch by 0.25 units in the direction of the normal. Set the sketch scale to 0.75. This will create the first part of the final shape. The dimensions of this part are approximately 0.75 units in length, 0.75 units in width, and 0.25 units in height. **Part 2** Create the second part of the shape by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0066, 0.25]. Create a sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. The sketch should contain one face with a loop consisting of four lines. The lines have the following start and end points: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.2463, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.2463, 0.0] to [0.2463, 0.4934] - Line 3: [0.2463, 0.4934] to [0.0, 0.4934] - Line 4: [0.0, 0.4934] to [0.0, 0.0] Extrude the sketch by 0.375 units in the direction of the normal. Set the sketch scale to 0.4934. This will create the second part of the final shape. The dimensions of this part are approximately 0.493 units in length, 0.493 units in width, and 0.375 units in height. Combine the second part with the first part using a JoinFeatureOperation. **Part 3** Create the third part of the shape by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.25]. Create a sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. The sketch should contain one face with a loop consisting of four lines. The lines have the following start and end points: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.5, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.5, 0.0] to [0.5, 0.5] - Line 3: [0.5, 0.5] to [0.0, 0.5] - Line 4: [0.0, 0.5] to [0.0, 0.0] Extrude the sketch by 0.375 units in the direction of the normal. Set the sketch scale to 0.5. This will create the third part of the final shape. The dimensions of this part are approximately 0.5 units in length, 0.5 units in width, and 0.375 units in height. Combine the third part with the combined first and second parts using a JoinFeatureOperation. The final shape is a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top, with dimensions approximately 1.0 units in length, 0.75 units in width, and 0.5 units in height. The tapered top is a result of the staggered height of the three parts.</description>
